title: Frame Semantics: What I Learned Building a Parser
summary: Notes on evaluation pitfalls, prompt design, and the small decisions that improved frame identification accuracy.

blocks.text: This post captures the practical lessons from building a frame identification pipeline and the decisions that moved the needle.
Calibration and abstention were the difference between decent and dependable.
The hardest part was not finding the frame but deciding when to abstain. Calibration mattered more than expected, especially with ambiguous triggers.
Consistent templates and stronger negative examples improved precision. The biggest gains came from tightening the evaluation set and tracking per-frame confusion.

items: Ship a lightweight error dashboard to spot drift early.
Expand diagnostics for rare frames and domain shifts.
